1.caption_api: Mayor Fred Eisenberger sent a sternly worded email to councillors about attendance.
1.desc_api: Most council members show up at a majority of the meetings they’re supposed to attend. But they don’t always stick around, a problem you won’t see in the statistics.

2.title_api: Ancaster candidate Kevin Marley wants LRT to move ahead
2.caption_api: Ancaster resident Kevin Marley registered at the deadline July 27 to run against Ancaster Councillor Lloyd Ferguson in the fall municipal election.
2.desc_api: “(LRT) seems good for the community and it will have an important impact on the ridership,” said Ancaster council candidate Kevin Marley

3.desc_api: City left one candidate off list of nominees.

4.title_api: Ward 10 council candidates target traffic, speeding in Stoney Creek area
4.caption_api: Speeding is just one aspect of traffic violations that the Haldimand OPP will be focusing on throughout the month of August.
4.desc_api: THE ISSUE: SERVICE ROAD TRAFFIC IMPACT: SPEED LIMIT REDUCTION PLANNED

5.title_api: Ancaster Coun. Lloyd Ferguson faces four opponents in his re-election bid
5.caption_api: Ancaster Coun. Lloyd Ferguson will have to defeat four opponents to retain his council seat in this fall’s municipal election. In 2006 he edged four contenders to win his first Ancaster councillor win.
5.desc_api: Ancaster Coun. Lloyd Ferguson will need to defeat four opponents, the same number in his 2006 race, to win re-election.

6.title_api: West Flamborough Coun. Robert Pasuta decides not run in new ward
6.caption_api: Ward 14 Coun. Robert Pasuta has decided not to seek reelection in a new ward after an OMB decision wiped out his all-rural west Flamborough ward.
6.desc_api: After 12 years representing Ward 14 at Hamilton City Hall, Robert Pasuta decided not to stand for reelection in a new ward.

7.title_api: Who’s running in the Burlington municipal election in October?
7.desc_api: There are a total of 63 candidates registered for the City of Burlington municipal election happening this fall.

8.title_api: Who’s running for Catholic trustee in Hamilton?
8.desc_api: HAMILTON — Eighteen candidates have registered to represent Hamilton Catholic ratepayers in the fall municipal election. That number is slightly less than the 21 candidates who ran for Catholic trustee in 2014.

9.title_api: Agostino family members seek to join Hamilton Catholic school board of trustees
9.caption_api: Ralph Agostino is looking to make a comeback as a Hamilton Catholic school board trustee.
9.desc_api: Ralph Agostino is looking to make a political comeback.

10.title_api: Stoney Creek’s Cam Galindo changes political paths and enters trustee race
10.caption_api: Cam Galindo (left), who kicked off his Ward 9 campaign for council in June, switched paths and unexpectedly registered to run for public school trustee for wards 9 and 10. He is competing against former NDP MP Wayne Marston.
10.desc_api: “I came to realize as a trustee, I could benefit the community with my background in education,” said Galindo.

11.title_api: Ward 13 election campaign features 5 Dundas residents, 1 Flamborough resident

12.title_api: Profiles of candidates in the 2018 Hamilton municipal election
12.caption_api: Mayoral candidates, from top left, Edward Graydon, Fred Eisenberger, Phil Ryerson, Nathalie Xian Yi Yan, George Rusich, Vito Sgro, Ute Schmid-Jones, Jim Davis, Paul Fromm. Not pictured are Henry Geissler, Todd May, Carlos Gomes, Ricky Tavares, Michael Pattison and Mark Wozny.
12.desc_api: Meet the people who want to govern our civic affairs.

13.title_api: Ontario Premier Doug Ford is correct on council size
13.desc_api: Hamilton has way too many councillors compared to Peel, Mississauga
13.label_api: OPINION | Darryl J. Hicks | Hamilton Mountain News

14.title_api: White nationalist Paul Fromm runs for mayor of Hamilton
14.caption_api: Paul Fromm, who ran twice to be the mayor of Mississauga has registered to run for mayor of Hamilton.
14.desc_api: “I have never been associated with a hate group. I’m not promoting hatred,” said Fromm.

15.title_api: Hamilton council to have new look after 2018 municipal election
15.caption_api: There are a total of 104 candidates running for Hamilton city hall in the 2018 municipal election. One of them is Louie Milojevic (right) who filled out his registration papers July 27 for Ward 10, the last day to file documents for the Oct. 22 election.
15.desc_api: There are 30 female candidates running in 2018, including two for mayor. In 2003 there were six female candidates and none for mayor.

16.title_api: Eleven in race to be Hamilton Ward 7’s next councillor
16.caption_api: In the March 2016 byelection, 22 candidates were in the race for the Ward 7 council seat.
16.desc_api: It’s not quite as big of a field as there was during the 2016 byelection, but there is still plenty of choice in Ward 7 council race.

17.title_api: Hamilton Mayor Fred Eisenberger says ward boundary structure needs to be re-examined
17.caption_api: Hamilton Mayor Fred Eisenberger says the city should consider changing its ward boundaries to copy the existing provincial and federal riding lines.
17.desc_api: “We need to look at how we are governed,” said Eisenberger.

18.title_api: Hamilton Mayor Fred Eisenberger attempts to be city’s first mayor to win re-election in post-amalgamation era
18.caption_api: Mayor Fred Eisenberger is facing off against 14 challengers in this year’s race for mayor.
18.desc_api: “I’m running as if I’m running to lose,” said Hamilton Mayor Fred Eisenberger.

19.title_api: Hamilton votes: Will new ward boundaries mean new faces on council?
19.caption_api: April 27 , 2018—The fencing surrounding the new HAMILTON sign at Hamilton City Hall was removed Friday morning in anticipation of the official lighting of the sign to take place later that evening .Photo by Scott Gardner, The Hamilton Spectator
19.desc_api: The city’s tribunal-imposed ward boundary shakeup could give newcomer candidates a better chance at beating the incumbent advantage

20.title_api: Late flurry expands Dundas public school trustee choices
20.desc_api: Five candidates are running for public school trustee in the realigned Ward 13 covering Dundas and west Flamborough following a late rush of registrations.

21.title_api: Who’s running in the Burlington municipal election in October?
21.desc_api: BURLINGTON — There are a total of 63 candidates registered for the City of Burlington municipal election happening this fall.

22.title_api: Hamilton election not affected by provincial ward boundary shakeup in Toronto
22.caption_api: The proposed ward boundary legislation announced by Premier Doug Ford Friday will not affect Hamilton city council in 2018.
22.desc_api: The province says the last-minute plan to radically redraw political boundaries in Toronto in time for the Oct. 22 election will not be mirrored in Hamilton.

23.title_api: Paikin Miller mum on Hamilton school trustee candidacy
23.desc_api: Hamilton East-Stoney Creek MPP Paul Miller’s wife is running against the employee who filed a human rights complaint and a dozen union grievances against him for alleged bullying, harassment and discrimination.

24.title_api: Former Stoney Creek Coun. Brad Clark wants his old political job back
24.desc_api: ” I have been meeting with residents and they want me to run,” said former Stoney Creek Coun. Brad Clark.

25.desc_api: A Ward 5 candidate for public school trustee admits he posted a joke about ugly women on his Facebook page, but insists he had no role in another one telling men how to fend off female rapists.

26.title_api: Self-proclaimed white nationalist Paul Fromm running for mayor in Hamilton
26.caption_api: Paul Fromm is running for mayor in Hamilton
26.desc_api: The self-proclaimed white nationalist said he moved to the city six months ago

27.title_api: Ward 15 trustee Penny Deathe seeks re-election
27.desc_api: Hamilton-Wentworth District School Board Ward 15 trustee Penny Deathe has filed for re-election.

28.title_api: Stoney Creek Coun. Doug Conley fights for limited city funds for community projects
28.caption_api: Doug Conley, Ward 9 councillor, is shown in a Sept. 7, 2016 file photo.
28.desc_api: Stoney Creek Coun. Doug Conley’s biggest complaint during his four-year term on Hamilton council is the lack of funds available to improve his ward.

29.desc_api: Coverage of the upcoming municipal election in Hamilton. Voting day is Oct. 22.

30.title_api: Hamilton’s new council will select city’s top bureaucrat, says Mayor Fred Eisenberger
30.caption_api: Hamilton Mayor Fred Eisenberger said the next council should decide who will replace outgoing city manager Chris Murray. Murray, who has been in the position since 2009, is leaving Aug. 13 to become Toronto’s city manager.
30.desc_api: “I sense that this council ought not be the decision maker. The next council can be the one,” said Hamilton Mayor Fred Eisenberger.

31.title_api: Hamilton’s LRT project dominates municipal election
31.caption_api: Hamilton mayoral candidates Fred Eisenberger and Vito Sgro are touring the city’s festivals talking about the future of the light-rail transit project.
31.desc_api: “The voters will have their say in October,” said Hamilton Mayor Fred Eisenberger.

32.title_api: Acclaimed Catholic trustee Valvasori adds Ward 15 to his portfolio
32.caption_api: Acclaimed Hamilton-Wentworth Catholic District School Board Trustee Mark Valvasori will represent Catholic ratepayers in wards 1-2 and 15.
32.desc_api: HWCDSB trustee Mark Valvasori will be representing Waterdown and Flamborough Catholic ratepayers following the Oct. 22 municipal election. The acclaimed candidate for wards 1-2 will add Ward 15 to his portfolio of schools.

33.title_api: Upper Stoney Creek contenders challenge Brad Clark, Doug Conley for Ward 9 seat
33.caption_api: While former Coun. Brad Clark and incumbent Coun. Doug Conley get noticed, Ward 9 candidates say they shouldn’t be ignored in this fall’s municipal election.
33.desc_api: “People have told me they have never seen the councillor,” said Ward 9 council candidate Dave Ford.

34.title_api: Stoney Creek resident Vivian Saunders’ complaint against Hamilton councillors stalled
34.caption_api: Stoney Creek resident Vivian Saunders’ legal attempt to get a court hearing to see if an audit is required on Hamilton Couns. Terry Whitehead and Jason Farr’s 2014 campaign expenses was delayed by the justice Aug. 24.
34.desc_api: Ontario Justice Martha Zivolak asked that Stoney Creek resident Vivian Saunders provide original appeal documents for her appeal.

35.title_api: Hamilton councillors Terry Whitehead, Jason Farr back in court over 2014 finance issues
35.caption_api: Stoney Creek resident Vivian Saunders will return to court requesting a compliance audit of councillors Terry Whitehead and Jason Farr’s 2014 election finance documents. Saunders launched the appeal in January 2016.
35.desc_api: “I strongly believe the allege contraventions are deserving of further considerations,” said Stoney Creek resident Vivian Saunders.

36.title_api: Skelly says no danger to Hamilton LRT funding
36.caption_api: Flamborough-Glanbrook MPP Donna Skelly said that the new PC government will not pull funding for the $1-billion LRT line planned in Hamilton.
36.desc_api: MPP says if LRT ends up dying it will be because new municipal council decides not to go ahead, Andrew Dreschel writes.

37.title_api: Dundas events scheduled to hear from municipal election candidates
37.desc_api: Debate and meeting scheduled for September

38.title_api: Waterdown’s Janet Creet running for public board trustee
38.caption_api: Waterdown’s Janet Creet is running for the Hamilton-Wentworth District School Board’s Ward 15 trustee seat.
38.desc_api: Longtime Waterdown resident Janet Creet has thrown her hat in the ring for the Hamilton-Wentworth District School Board’s Ward 15 trustee race.

39.title_api: Former MP Eve Adams in crowded Ward 8 council race
39.caption_api: Former MP Eve Adams is running in Hamilton’s municipal election.
39.desc_api: Adams grew up on the Mountain but earned headlines — sometimes controversial — as a politician in the GTA.

40.title_api: Johnstone faces two rivals for Ancaster trustee
40.desc_api: Incumbent Alex Johnstone faces a young Conservative activist and a political neophyte who wants to fix poor student math scores as she seeks a third term as Hamilton public school trustee for Ancaster and Glanbrook this fall.

41.title_api: It’s time Hamilton had a female mayor, say candidates
41.caption_api: Hamilton mayoral candidate Ute Schmid-Jones (right) is one of two women running for mayor. There are 31 women running for council in 2018, the highest number in the city’s post-amalgamation era.
41.desc_api: “It is said academically that females have many advantages and strengths that are better than men,” said Hamilton mayoral candidate Nathalie Xian Yi Yan.

42.title_api: Hamilton mayoral candidate Vito Sgro says LRT won’t “serve the needs” of the city
42.caption_api: Hamilton mayoral candidate Vito Sgro chats will a few of the estimated 500 people who attended a fund-raising event Aug. 9 at Michelangelos Banquet Centre.
42.desc_api: “In my opinion, (LRT) is not worth it at all. It’s not going to serve the needs of Hamilton,” said Hamilton mayoral candidate Vito Sgro.

43.title_api: Stoney Creek Coun. Maria Pearson faces 3 challengers for Ward 10 seat
43.desc_api: Maria Pearson is hoping to continue a nearly 25-year run as an elected representative in Stoney Creek.

44.title_api: Former Mississauga MP Eve Adams seeks Ward 8 council seat in Hamilton
44.caption_api: Former Mississauga MP Eve Adams is seeking the Ward 8 council seat over five other candidates for this fall’s municipal election.
44.desc_api: “My family has been here for 40 years,” said former Mississauga MP Eve Adams.

45.title_api: Sgro launches mayoral campaign with big fundraiser
45.desc_api: Mayoral candidate stakes out opposition to LRT

46.title_api: Stoney Creek resident Louie Milojevic takes another stab at Ward 10 election
46.caption_api: Stoney Creek resident Louie Milojevic is challenging incumbent Ward 10 Coun. Maria Pearson in this fall’s election.
46.desc_api: “I’m running in 2018 out of a sense of duty,” said Louie Milojevic, Stoney Creek resident.

47.title_api: Waterdown resident a candidate for Catholic board’s Wards 12 and 13 trustee race
47.caption_api: Phil Homerski is vying for a spot at the HWCDSB table as the trustee for Wards 12 and 13. Voters go to the polls Oct. 22.
47.desc_api: A Waterdown resident has entered the Hamilton-Wentworth Catholic District School Board trustee race for Wards 12 and 13.

48.title_api: Hamilton’s coyote issue starting to get political
48.caption_api: Dan MacIntyre, a Ward 7 candidate in Hamilton’s fall municipal election, is calling on the city to remove what he calls a coyote den in Bruleville Park. Here, a coyote stands in the median of a roadway in a file photo.
48.desc_api: “I fear we’re getting to the point that … it will take someone being attacked for the city to act,” municipal candidate warns.

49.title_api: Burlington mayoral candidate Meed Ward calls phone survey a ‘dirty tactic’
49.caption_api: Burlington mayoral candidate Meed Ward says she caught wind of the Campaign Research survey through residents who fielded the calls.
49.desc_api: Lawyer for Campaign Research says Toronto-based clients “vehemently contest” city councillor’s take on questionnaire.

50.title_api: What’s new in this Burlington election?
50.desc_api: Elections are in full swing across Ontario today, and expect signs to be popping up like mushrooms after next week.

51.title_api: $95,448 a year: Running for Hamilton council
51.caption_api: It doesn’t matter if a councillor is a seasoned incumbent with years of service or a raw newbie learning the ropes, all 15 members of council get the same straight payment for services — $95,448 a year.
51.desc_api: Councillor salaries put them in top 10 per cent of income earners, writes Andrew Dreschel

52.title_api: Don’t expect equal coverage for Hamilton’s mayoral candidates
52.caption_api: Mayoral candidates, from top left, Edward Graydon, Fred Eisenberger, Phil Ryerson, Nathalie Xian Yi Yan, George Rusich, Vito Sgro, Ute Schmid-Jones, Jim Davis, Paul Fromm. Not pictured are Henry Geissler, Todd May, Carlos Gomes, Ricky Tavares, Michael Pattison and Mark Wozny.
52.desc_api: If you want to be elected mayor, you have to work for it, writes Andrew Dreschel

53.title_api: Dundas’s Neil Chopp vies for HWCDSB Ward 12 and 13 trustee
53.caption_api: Neil Chopp says he’s ready and able to make the transition to trustee for Ancaster, Dundas and west Flamborough.
53.desc_api: A new face has entered the race for the chance to represent Wards 12 and 13 at the Hamilton-Wentworth Catholic District School Board during the municipal elections in October.

54.title_api: Hamilton municipal election advance poll dates and locations
54.desc_api: Hamilton voters have five advance poll opportunities to cast a ballot ahead of the Oct. 22 municipal election.
